derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English calcatrippe, denoting any plant which tended to catch the feet, from medieval Latin calcatrippa, from calx 'heel' or calcare 'to tread' + a word related to trap. Sense 1 was probably adopted from French

means.word_mean: 1. tropical annual procumbent poisonous subshrub having fruit that splits into five spiny nutlets; serious pasture weed
2. a plant of the genus Trapa bearing spiny four-pronged edible nutlike fruits
3. Mediterranean annual or biennial herb having pinkish to purple flowers surrounded by spine-tipped scales; naturalized in America
